intro: Tragacantha ovalis, commonly known as the oval tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces a viscous gum, similar to tragacanth, which has been used historically in medicine and as a food additive. Tragacantha ovalis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and historical contexts.
